Description: Wooden statue group of Hepiy, son of Irterau, and wife Ptahirdis, dedicated by their son Iymhotep; hieroglyphic text of feast list on back, including the Opening of the Year, New Year’s Day, Full and Half Moon Festivals, the Thoth Feast, and the Festival of Sokar.
Curator's comments: The feast list is an archaic version, similar to Old Kingdom lists. Published in: British Museum, 1922. Guide to the Fourth, Fifth and Sixth Egyptian Rooms, and the Coptic Room, p. 25 Porter & Moss viii, p. 763 Regulski, I. (ed.), 2022. Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt, pp. 176-7
Bibliographic references: Spalinger 1996 / The private feast lists of ancient Egypt (p. 81 (no. 31), 107 (no. 5), pl. 4)
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, Hieroglyphs: unlocking ancient Egypt 2023 17 Mar-18 Jun, Hull, Ferens Art Gallery, NP Egyptian hieroglyphs 2023 28 Jun-12 Oct, Lisburn, Irish Linen Centre & Lisburn Museum, NP Egyptian hieroglyphs 2023-2024 21 Oct-18 Feb, Torquay Museum, NP Egyptian hieroglyphs
